And he's got a slew of felony charges, felonious assault, gun charges, drug charges, and he just revolving doors out of there because you have a stupid D.A. there that's trying to reduce the prison population and rehabilitate everybody, restorative justice, as that kind of ridiculous mind-set. And then goes to mows down about 50 people, five dead. You know, they're putting people back together literally at the hospital right now. And Joe Biden's asked about it and he says, you know what, I don't want to say too much, still waiting for some of the facts and the details to come out. Okay. Well, Rittenhouse after that happened two days later slandered the guy as a white supremacist when there was video showing he was acting in self- defense. Now, this guy in Wisconsin was not acting in self-defense. The video clearly shows he is mowing people down and he's being charged with intentional homicide, but Joe Biden is holding his tongue, okay. And the media is basically memory hold the story already, I wonder why. We all know why. It doesn't need to be said. And what we heard yesterday was total garbage that he was fleeing a knife fight. Now, who drives through a parade to flee a knife fight? Doesn't make any sense. What? Are people throwing knives at his car? It makes no sense. And there was no pursuit because you see the guy on the door dash camera, the guy is having a sandwich while police are trying to find -- he's having a sandwich. He's not fleeing a knife fight. Get out of here! So everybody knows what's going on. It's horrible and, you know, the media is just going to pigeonhole it and we're going to have to pick up the pieces.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The D.A. there in Milwaukee, in 2007, this -- you got -- let me read this to you. He said this. "Is there going to be an individual I divert or I put in the treatment program who is going to go out and kill somebody? You bet, guaranteed. It's guaranteed to happen. It does not invalidate the overall approach." But Jessica, I think that yes, this actually invalidates the approach?

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: A 100 percent. I mean, that's -- we can take gambles with certain groups of offenders and I think when Rashida Tlaib obviously did herself no favors in that interview and I don't know why anyone shows up to be interviewed by Jonathan Swan unprepared. He is amazing at what he does, and he gets people clearly to talk about things that they didn't intend on talking about the certain aspects of the bills or the policies that they support. There has to be a very serious conversation about who should get bail reform applied to them and what kind of offenders should not be able to have this. Absolutely with this one it raises a larger question about, you know, we treat people over assaulted women, obviously, the 15-year-old sex trafficking charge and getting her pregnant. That is something where this person, you know, a $1,000 bail is not enough for them. And I think Kyle Rittenhouse had a $2 million bail. Now, I'm not saying that Kyle Rittenhouse shouldn't have had a high bail, I believe that he should have, but the disparity is something for us to take note of. I don't think the media is going to pigeonhole this. I think it was something, at least, following along on social media and watching all the live coverage that everyone is taking very seriously this weekend and I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not today. We haven't seen it today, not a lot yesterday. Go on to CNN or MSNBC home page, not really there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's not really there. Dagen, we have taken it around the table here. We'll go to you next on the (inaudible) says he, Darrell Brooks is in court for the first time.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Well, speaking of Ocasio-Cortez and Rashida Tlaib and their ill -- dangerous zealots are going to zealot dangerously. But I want them to go, go, go. Keep at it. Keep complaining about dangerous individuals who are being held on bail even in New York City where we had bail reform at the beginning of last year where manslaughter, arson, and child assault, no bail. No pre-trial, detention, cash bail. They tweaked it a little bit. But basically you can punch some old lady in the face and you're right back out on the street. I want them to go, go, go and continue to expose themselves for who they are they are and what they want. The more they spit in the faces of victims and their families, which is what you're doing with Raskin and Maloney and Ocasio-Cortez releasing this, complaints about bail, people being held on bail right after this deadly -- this murders in Waukesha. Let them continue to attack or not stand up for innocent Americans. They don't care about safety and security for this country. They would rather coddle criminals to accumulate more power. So please, keep jacking your jaws and this will end and it will end soon because we always talk about New York City. People go, oh, it's not -- it's New York City. No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And it's happening.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It is -- many cities across the country where, again, victims -- think about the 11-year-old girl who's telling doctors in Waukesha please glue me back together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And these left wing mouthpieces can't shut up and think about the families who are grieving, think about the moms and the dads and the sisters and the brothers who are grieving and suffering as their family, they've lost loved ones or they have people in the hospital. It's just disgusting that they can't shut their traps for a day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Brian, one of the widowers who lost his wife in this rampage said that his wife's life and his children's future was certainly worth more than a thousand dollars.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN KILMEADE, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I would think so. And (inaudible) -- the guy is, oops. Chisholm (ph) says, oops, I made a mistake. Yes, it was way too low. We're going to look into that. I would like to know who -- I liked a full accounting of everybody on probation right now in Wisconsin, in this area to find out if there's any mother oops out there would be killer that might be lurking who's out on $500 bail or $1,000 or $2,000. You guys pretty much covered it. I like to add a couple of things. The thing that I find most scary is, I believe Democrats and Republicans were run over by this guy. I don't believe they really had a party preference. And I think that one thing is pretty universal as you heard James Carville speak up and other Democrats say the stupidest thing they ever heard was defund the police. And we're seeing now is the tone deafness of these Democrats saying let's start with this bail reform, no cash bail along with defund the police. We are seeing the one -- this is one story. The looting in San Francisco coming up later. The Rittenhouse story coming up next. And this story is all the same thing, defaming, defanging, and defunding the police is all about the lack of law and order in all three places. Please tell me how that benefits the American citizen, the American family. They are alienating the American people. You're not helping Democrats. And I just find it so hard to believe that President Biden seems to be listening to the squad and the left wing not the middle of his party. How could he be this tone deaf? I understand was to sign them, but I never thought they'd be driving the administration. That's the scary thing for the country. Forget about the party in the next election.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's hard to come back from that. All right, coming up, Kyle Rittenhouse warning President Biden and the media that they might want to lawyer up as well.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: The new guys don't usually get to pick their music so this the first time. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Dagen's going (inaudible) at you right now.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: All right. Meanwhile, some serious stuff now. Kyle Rittenhouse hitting back after a year of relentless attacks in an exclusive interview with our own Tucker Carlson. The newly acquitted 18-year-old hinting lawsuits could be coming while ripping the media and the president of the United States who suggested he is a white supremist.

utterances.speaker: KYLE RITTENHOUSE
utterances.utterance: Mr. President, if I could say one thing to you I would urge you to go back and watch the trial and understand the facts before you make a statement. It's actual malice, defaming my character for him to say something like that. The lies that they can just get away with spreading is just sickening and it's a disgrace to this country. I'm hoping one day there will be some -- there would be accountability for their actions that they did.

utterances.speaker: TUCKER CARLSON, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: You're not going to let that go?

utterances.speaker: RITTENHOUSE
utterances.utterance: Like I said, really good lawyers are handling that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Peter Doocey grilling Jen Psaki a little while ago after over whether the president will apologize or not.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: This is about a campaign video released last year that used President Trump's own words during a debate as he refused to condemn white supremacists and militia groups.

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCEY, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: And you're saying that it was just a campaign video, it wasn't. The president also gave an interview where he said this Rittenhouse was part of a militia coming out of Illinois.

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.utterance: He has obviously condemned the hatred and division and violence we've seen around the country by groups like the Proud Boys and groups that that individual has posed in photos with.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: So Jesse, she pointed that out. The apology is not coming and she tried to qualify him using the term white supremist, which he also tweeted. I'm sure he didn't tweet himself, but on his account, tweeted out about white supremacy has got to stop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know if Kyle knew who is in the photo. People come up to me all the time. They ask for photos. I just think they have great taste. I don't ask them about their resume. Joe Biden eulogized a Grand Kleagle of the Ku Klux Klan, Robert Byrd. I think he knew Robert Byrd was in the clan when he went to his funeral and eulogized him. Barack Obama took photos with Farrakhan. I think Barack knew who Farrakhan was. Also, he was married by Reverend Wright. Does that mean that Barack Obama is an anti-Semite? Does that mean Joe Biden is a clansman? Of course it doesn't. But that's her analogy and it's bogus. Now, I have never seen anybody look so different than what they're portrayed on in the media.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: He was impressive, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was impressed. He looked like a guy you could have over for Thanksgiving dinner. Who would you rather have babysit your children, him or Rosenbaum? I think you want Kyle Rittenhouse there. The mainstream media is now moved from demonizing politicians to demonizing regular people. You know, they go after the McCluskies. They go after the Nick Sandmans. They go after Kyle Rittenhouse. They go after parents for speaking out. And the American people have seen that. They're repulsed by it. And I hope Hunter really did hold 10 for the big guy because Joe might have to pony up some dough here because that was libelous what he said.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Jessica, I thought that Jonathan Turley could came on today this afternoon and said as a public figure, Whoopi Goldberg and people like the president are kind of immune to this type of lawsuits.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Jonathan Turley is a better lawyer than I am. He is a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But your thoughts on this.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Yes. My thoughts on this, I thought that Kyle Rittenhouse did come over -- did come across very well in his interview with Tucker. I thought he was well prepared for it and also very clear about the points he wanted to make and the sideshow stuff that he didn't want to get involved in. He didn't want to be having a lot of the conversations that pundits have been having about his intentions and he really wanted to make a larger point about what he saw his case as which was a self-defense case. And I thought that made a big impact on people and he had one line that I thought was particularly important. You know, he said I'm a supporter of the Black Lives Matter Movement. We don't know about that photo with the Proud Boys. Maybe it was just two guys walked up to him and said take a picture with me. Maybe it was more than that. But he said something like think about what would have happened if I was a black person in this position who had done this. How would my trial have gone differently? And to acknowledge that, that's so core to people who support the Black Lives Matter Movement that they acknowledge that. And the fact that he brought that forward, it wasn't an extension -- it wasn't what Tucker asked him. And I thought that that was a really important gesture towards the "other side" of this fight to say I understand the systemic challenges facing black people in this system and I thought he did really well by himself.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You know there's already been one walk back. "Face the Nation" came out and said, you know, we -- Mark Straussman did get it wrong when he said he crossed state lines, he used a wrong gun. He shot a black man seven times in the back. That was obviously wrong. "Face the Nation" walked that back. Kyle Rittenhouse testified that he did not drive to Kenosha with a weapon. He was there already. It was not illegal for Rittenhouse to possess that particular weapon. That is true. And we apologize for the oversight in language.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you think they did that out of the goodness of their heart --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: No --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because they think that there is like some morality play that's happening here. No? Lots of people are about to get sued and to me this is like laying the groundwork to be like we are -- we owned up to our mistake, sorry. Please don't sue us. So, they probably are not the first. I'm glad they did it. But the other thing I wanted to say is you go back to that exchange with Jen Psaki and Peter Doocey. I don't blame Jen Psaki. She was basically having to answer for something that happened in the campaign --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Nothing to do with her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and she didn't have to -- she didn't have to answer but she's having to defend it. But why won't the commander-in-chief, the president of the United States who ran on being the unifier of the country be able to say I never should have said that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It would be great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I never should have said that. That's all he has to say. Then Jen Psaki won't get asked about it all the time and they can talk about Build Back Better and how they're going to save the world, sorry Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Kyle Rittenhouse by what he said in acknowledging that his trial might have looked differently in his opinion if he had been black instead of white. That is more unifying than anything else that has been said in this entire trial by anyone else, and he's 18-years-old.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I hear you. Dagen, he spent 87 days in jail. He didn't have to. His attorney, his prior attorney is Lin Wood, he claims -- told him you're safer there. They raised money on his defense. One of his attorney said he was in a militia. He goes I don't even know what a militia is. I mean that's another sub story to this that came out --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's disgusting.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: -- in that interview.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I noticed that it was a defense attorney after the acquittal on Friday that he immediately came out and started talking about his prior attorneys and how they were using-- using Kyle Rittenhouse for a cause because he was lucky he got that defense saying --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Imagine sitting at one room jail, wonder -- and thinking your attorneys are working for you and they're actually making money off you, leaving you sequestered.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Just to compare the $2 million bail that Kyle Rittenhouse had to put up and the $1,000 bail that this murderer --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- this alleged murderer got out on. It just -- I don't understand. So, Kyle Rittenhouse, in the language he was using, he used the words malice and defamation. He has a really good lawyer as he said. So those are the legal -- I'm not a lawyer, but I know legal words when I see them. Those are the legal terms that he would have to use. So, I -- to that point, I don't understand why the D.C. clutter boxes on T.V. like at "The View" keep talking about Rittenhouse the way that they do. Why do their bosses allow this? Just -- can't you -- like, where are the grown-ups who are running these networks? And they talk about Rittenhouse -- I don't understand why they're so worked up over the death of a pedophile, mentally-ill child molester that they keep harping on this. But that's who they are.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: We've talked about this a few times -- I know that we have to go. He didn't know that Rosenbaum was a pedophile or child molester when this happened.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: But they know it now and they know he's been acquitted so, they need to stick a sock in it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. The jury know.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Oh, wait. One more thing, Facebook's going to get sued. You mark my words because Facebook didn't ban any commentary that supported Kyle Rittenhouse initially. They prevented any fundraising for his defense and they would only allow declarations of his guilt and not his innocence. So, you go for the -- you go for the big pockets, the biggest pocket in the country.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And they should -- and they should announce that suit on Twitter to pay justice.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Twitter did it, too.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Okay. Straight ahead, President Biden with a desperate move to control soaring gas prices, but will it make a difference? Think about that question while we're in break.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: President Biden trying make the case that the economy is in good shape after a supply crisis and inflation took a huge bite out of his approval numbers. Biden rolling out a new plan to fight off rising prices at the gas pump by releasing 50 million barrels of oil from our Strategic Petroleum Reserves.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDEN OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: Today, I'm announcing that the largest ever release from the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve to help provide the supply we need as we recover from this pandemic. I also want to briefly address one myth about inflated gas prices. They are not due to environmental measures. My effort to combat climate change is not raising the price of gas or increasing its availability.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: And the Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm being criticized for the answer to this question.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: There is various figures about this. I'm curious if you know. How many barrels of oil does the U.S. consume per day?

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER GRANHOLM, ENERGY SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: I don't have that number in front of me, sorry.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Dana, what say you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, so you should probably know that if you are the secretary of energy, probably (ph), I suggest.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: That would be eight pounds (ph) of fuel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So tapping the SPR -- so Joe Biden talks about how long he's been in Washington and how much experience he has. Any president that tries to tap the Strategic Petroleum Reserve in order to deal with prices -- we're not actually in an oil emergency, it's like a gnat on an elephant. It doesn't have the impact that it wants to do. And also it's just so craven, right? They do it right before Thanksgiving. And tapping the SPR is really just making up for the bad policy from before. So, canceling Keystone, canceling oil and gas leases, discouraging investment, not allowing ANWR to go through, so then you have to tap the SPR which is not going to do anything and you get through Thanksgiving and they're just like basically hoping that it all goes away. It's the same thing with the eviction moratorium. That wasn't working out. The money wasn't going out the door so then they had to like figure out other policy. And then they have to go to the courts, and they basically get saved by the courts until they can't do that. Or they're driving up inflation with bad policy. And now, they're like, oh, wait, now what are we going to do because of inflation? So, it's one thing after another. But the other thing about Jennifer Granholm, the Secretary, is yesterday -- and she's not the only one. The administration's position on this has been higher gas prices are the price that all of us are going to have to pay so that we can transition to a cleaner fuel for the climate. That's what they've said. So, she said that yesterday. Today, she's in the briefing room saying this is a very serious issue. It affects all low-income families. We're going to get on top of it. So, somebody called her between yesterday and today when they realized that their polling is so bad on this. Just now, there was a poll that said that 77 percent of people say they notice inflation and 57 percent of them blame Joe Biden. Whether that's fair or not, that's the reality that they're living in.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, to that point, Jesse, there's another poll out that, for 54 percent of Americans, the raising gas and grocery prices are a major concern. So, that's the highest level of concern for them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Joe doesn't seem very concerned, does he? He, I guess, wants higher prices. He said it. It makes it easier to transition to green. He just doesn't want to pay a political price for the high gas prices. So, they do this silly release, which does nothing. It's like what do we consume, Dagan, 20 million barrels a day, and he released his 50 million. That's like your mother --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: The oil went up today.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It did? OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It did go --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is like your mother asking you to bring over something for Thanksgiving and you show up with two Triscuits.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love Triscuits.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does that -- what does that going to do? I don't know. We're not going to get anywhere. He's been begging OPEC. OPEC is just going to give him the middle finger. The Crown Prince hates him because Joe called him a pariah after he murdered that journalist. So, it's like a blood feud and the American people are going to pay the price.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: That was deserving.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hey, you know what? He's taking it out on the American people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Better than Kyle -- calling Kyle Rittenhouse a white supremacist.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: OK. So, one thing that I find difficult to square, Brian, is so 70 percent of Americans have a negative outlook on the economy right now, but we do have the stock market surge, low unemployment, wages going up especially in the lower-paid sectors. Why do you think that that's happening?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I think it's because practical use. When you walk -- you know, Joe Biden says everything is back on the shelves, which is ridiculous, because it's not. But if he said it, I guess it works. He says everything is back on the shelves. The supply chain problem basically solved. So, if you look at the -- if things that you go to buy are more expensive. Things you go to buy, a lot of times we don't have them. You go to put gas in your car, it costs more. You actually try to buy stuff and you pay more and get less. You go out to a restaurant, and it costs more. The service isn't as good. People are not working. Sundays, that restaurant you like is closed because they're not staffed. So, when all these little areas around the country you're affected, and it affects the practical way we lead our lives which I find fascinating because it's apolitical. Everything I just mentioned has nothing to do with Republican philosophy or Democratic philosophy. It's making people say, is my life better now than it was in who is responsible for it? And he's always -- for somebody so experienced with experienced staff, I don't understand why he's always in reaction mode. He's never leading. Like, we got to get ahead of inflation. We got to get ahead of the concern about gas and oil. And now, he reacts just a day before he goes to a billionaire's house in Nantucket.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It's interesting, about the day-to-day, the CEO of Walmart was on TV talking about -- thanking President Biden for fixing the supply chain crisis. And the CEO of Etsy -- so over five million small businesses --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's fixed?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Yes. He said this was a better year than last year. What do you make of that?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Well, Walmart is big enough that one, it fixed its own problem --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It fixed it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because they were able to lease their own ships to make sure their stores were stocking. They're saying out loud, don't worry about the stores, the shelves being empty, because they don't want to discourage people from coming to shop. They're never going to tell you, oh, things are not in stock. And they're also scared. Their pants are in a twist over these cuckoo communists who are working in this administration. So, that's the political calculation on behalf of Walmart. But in terms of Joe Biden, the only thing I can think about is he's intentionally put deeply stupid people in these jobs so they can say stupid things which actually help cover up what the real intention is. Because Jen -- if they screw up and tell you the truth, thank them for that if they make a mistake like Jen Granholm. But I was reading Kyle Basse on Twitter. He was just working down the numbers that the world, because it's a global commodity, it consumes 100 million barrels per day, so we release 50 million barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. Kyle Bass, it's a rounding error. Expect $100 oil, $5.00 a gallon for gasoline for years to come because of the damage that was done --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It was 18 this year. 18 a day.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: OK. We got to go.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: 20 million in refined product, I think.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: We shall continue on the break. Up next, don't call it looting. Leaders being accused of making excuses as smash and grab robberies continue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't you dare call this looting. Liberals are focused on not hurting the feelings of smash and grab gangs than getting tough on crime. High-end businesses in San Francisco ransacked for a third night by mobs of looters. But it doesn't matter. Local media reporting woke experts and some officials are cautioning against using the word "looting" because it could be seen as racist, Brian Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It's unbelievable. They say racial connotations according to the University of New Haven. So, I would say a couple of things. This is -- this is also about the first story. It's law and disorder. It's happening around. 12 stores were hit in San Francisco. Oakland was hit 12 miles away at the same time. We're seeing in San Jose with the police department is reexamining what they're doing. This is part, I believe, of someone thinking this is reparations for society's inequities. That's what we're seeing. And I wonder why Gavin Newsom is mad now. He laid the groundwork for this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Reparation hunters, is that the new word?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think if we use that, we're going to get a call from the word police. But when they say not to use looting, and they want to use organized robbery or burglary -- like burglary --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That sounds worse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, organized robbery, I guess it is, but it's also, it's the looting. And if it were white people, I would call it the same.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. I mean, I've seen Whites, Blacks, Hispanics, everybody loots.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: New York really invented looting, I think, of all races and walks of life.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: WE did?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The New Yorker.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, every time the lights go out, everyone takes everyone else's stuff.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: OK, as a lifelong New Yorker, I wasn't familiar with that. But if you're playing word police, you're losing the real battle here. And that's something that folks like Jim Clyburn are on the right side of the defund the police thing have been saying. People know what they're seeing. And now that everything is being caught on video, they know exactly what it is. It doesn't matter what you call it, it's stealing things and people will use any number of synonyms for that. So, if you want to say smash and grab, and then 10 seconds later, you want to say looting, that is just fine. That is looting, it is stealing, it is smash and grab.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: No racial connotation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Smash and grab

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: No. I don't even know that was --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I like that phrase, smash and grab.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: You can use it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love it.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I'll license it to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: But people -- by the way, these thieves are not being stopped by the security guards in the stores very often because the stores are afraid of being called racist if they lay their hands on anybody, if they tried to detain them. Or I've seen it happen here in New York City. Somebody is stealing in broad daylight from a store and the security guard tries to get in front of the thieves and they scream rape or race -- you're a racist. Get your hands off of me. So, until the politicians and the police step in -- and it creates these poverty zones. We're talking about like not Louis Vuitton or Chanel here in New York, but Walgreens. Walgreens has shut down 17 stores in San Francisco already --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Closing five more. The death rate is five times the national average in that city. And it leaves people in low-income areas without access to drugs and goods and jobs quite frankly because the jobs disappear.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And medicines. You know, medicines.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I thought -- I thought this was a jobs presidency. Why would people be looting in a jobs presidency? It doesn't make any sense. And I'm really terrified to turn out the lights tonight.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I'm telling you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I'm going to leave the lights on tonight here in New York.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: What New Yorkers are going to do? Jesse Jr. is going to loot your room?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Ahead, outrageous suggestion from the liberal media for Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: We all know the liberal media is out of touch, but this next story would make Marie Antoinette blush. To counter inflation, an NBC host says American should ditch the turkey for Thanksgiving and shake down the guests for money.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Perhaps forgo the turkey. Bear with me. I know that is the staple of the Thanksgiving meal. However, some people think turkey is overrated, and so it tends to be the most expensive thing on the table. Maybe you do an Italian feast instead. But you could ask everybody to just throw in cash, $5.00, $10.00. That really adds up.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Dana, it's funnier than anything on Fallon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe. Maybe so. America did not get to be in this position of greatness by lowering expectations, but that's what we seem to be doing. And you could imagine that Jimmy Carter is stiing around going, wow. I wish the media had told everyone to suck it up when I was president as they are with him. And the Democrats I think run a real -- a real risk of wearing this general malaise as like, their favorite new outfit and they're wearing it around all over town. And like, isn't this general malaise look really great. And they're trying to convince themselves that it does. But I think that the polls, like, the ones that Jessica had in her block, that 77 percent of people say they are feeling inflation and 57 percent of them blame Joe Biden, that's real.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, they could at least have the grace, these Biden and company throw like, cans of cranberry sauce out of the windows of their home escalade as they're driving around.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I have a different take. I think this is free enterprise at its best. Why not make it a la carte? And for a slice of cranberry sauce, it would be a $1.25. So, pay on the go. I don't want to pay for the whole meal. No one likes everything on the table.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's right, because I don't eat --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I would like the stuffing in the turkey and maybe offer combo rates. For $9.95 you can both.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Two for one.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Because I don't want the creamed onions, I never liked the creamed onions. I don't believe onion should be creamed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who makes creamed onion?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: So, why do I have to pay for them?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You make creamed onions?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: My mom make creamed onions. You don't -- you don't have that? Is that new?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I've never heard of it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I guess we have extra onions.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Submit your order in advance, Brian, on your phone.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Thank you. You could do that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Dunkin Donuts has it, why not the Johnson family.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm not charging Uncle Lenny like $5.00 to get in the door to Thanksgiving. That's not going to go well.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Turn them to profit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And no offense to the Italians, but the pilgrims did not eat Rigatoni Bolognese when they came over.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But then, what if they could?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's true. And I actually researched this, Dagen.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm sure you did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Butterball which supplies a third of Thanksgiving turkeys, got hit with major labor shortages because of the vax mandate and all those Biden box, and the price of gasoline is rising, the transportation costs, so that's why you have increased prices with your turkey.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You know what I love about Butterball? They put the giblets in a packet and it's like crackerjack. So, like you go in, you pull out a surprise. Isn't that exciting?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just no -- don't chase it with a cream onions.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Don't do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Please.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Just quickly, don't go after things people love, like holidays, because those are the things that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Or Rittenhouse.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I don't know if people love Rittenhouse like they love turkey. Maybe you. Like, if you want people to save money, talk about helpful tips like taking public transport or like carpooling or whatever it is. But like, people are excited that they're vaccinated, majority of them, and that they can go see their families. Last Thanksgiving was not that great for a lot of people, Christmas, etcetera. If you want holiday cheer, you should go -- you should have the turkey. I do love those charts though, of what people would cut. It's so interesting when you find out like your friends hate the things that you love and blah, blah, blah. But pay for the turkey. Don't charge people for Friendsgiving. I guess people do that though, like, bring your own thing, but not at Uncle Larry's or wherever you're planning.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Lenny.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Lenny.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Elizabeth Warren is on the case. She's asked the Department of Justice to investigate the poultry industry. So --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Finally.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes, some --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, there's a lot of corruption in chicken.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Nobody is eating chicken.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Big turkey. Go get them.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Before we go, here's what I hate. I hate segments that have tips. I hate it. Don't tell me how to get to the meal. Don't --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You say tips, right?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I don't like -- I don't like --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Tips with a P.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I don't like the diet tips before Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Like, oh, don't eat the sweet potatoes because they're really high in calories. This is just as bad.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You know what the problem is? We pardon too many turkeys. We pardon way too many turkeys. Now, we --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We can't afford to pardon too many turkeys.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Sorry, reporting for duty.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We need criminal justice reform for the turkey.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I'm a vegetarian and I adopted a turkey from Farm Sanctuary named Bowie.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: OK, name your price.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Happy Thanksgiving, Bowie. You will have life for another year.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: "ONE MORE THING" next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, check out this crazy video of WWE superstar Seth Rollins. He got blindsided by a fan at the Barclays Center. Rollins was walking into the back after a match with Finn Baylor when a crazed fan came out of nowhere and speared him.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: In tights.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And the fan was then tackled by refs and security and removed. But the guy faces charges of attempted assault and attempted violation of Arts and Cultural Affairs.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Wow. I didn't know that was the (INAUDIBLE) of it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Disrupting a live sporting event is actually disrupting a cultural affair.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I had no idea that was true but --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's an extra five years.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Just send him away forever.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Well, if you show up in tights I would take -- I would get security. I mean, who would show up to a wrestling match in tights?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It's New York City.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If you're not wrestling?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, have you seen people walk -- people walk around in tights.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You're lucky he's got pants on at all.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: True, true, true. All right, holidays are just around the corner, have you heard? If you're looking for a book to give a child, I've got three for you here. So, Jesse, this is right up your alley. It's a children's book series called Heroes of liberty. It celebrates traditional American values, highlights conservative leaders who helped shape our country like Ronald Reagan, Thomas Sowell, Amy Coney Barrett also is included. They've got great illustrations. And in honor of these books, Percy has done his first book recommendation photograph.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There he is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it's right up my alley because I have a young son, right?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And you -- and you love to read.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And you will want to buy these for your children.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Children's books. Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: That was a live look, actually, of my nursery. That's what we'll be going.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But don't think I'm not going to gift these to you when I'm done with them.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: With Percy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. Dagen, you're next.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: This is a warning for you with Percy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, gosh.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Go visit mama with your dog, Samson. And where is he? On the roof. He got out of the house. Look, it's a St. Bernard. Samson was fine but this is -- Kyle Barrett was just hanging out with mama.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How did he get up there?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Children pooch. I don't know, but he did. That's something that - - that's something Percy would do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a big dog.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He's a rascal. I can see it in his eyes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: He's ready to rascal around on the roof.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He is. Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: All right. So, it was a fun night on Dancing with the Stars. I don't know if anyone else is a fan. But you are?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm a fan of Cody Rigsby.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I missed watching it. I didn't get a chance to watch it because I was watching other things. But yes, I'm so glad this is you "ONE MORE THING."

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: OK. So, former NBA star Iman Shumpert won Dancing with the Stars. He is making history. In 2016, he won the NBA championship, I should say. He was the first time that an NBA -- an ex-NBA player has taken home the mirror ball. He's dancing here with his pro-partner Daniela. What's cool is he's married to Teyana Taylor who's a recording artists. And she had a part in the song that they dance to win it all. And congratulations to them. It's such a fun show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You don't think Cody Rigsby was robbed?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: He had a tough -- I mean, the COVID -- it was not great that he got COVID and they had to do remote dancing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he did pretty well.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: He did -- especially because --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: There was an earlier dance --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: His moves on the bike aren't great.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: There was an earlier dance in the season. It was modern. It was - -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like a Brian's style.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Real quick. I have a question for you guys.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Brian is like -- you have an entire minute.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Are you ready? What is the fastest thing the human body can do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Spit.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Blink?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Blink?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Sneeze?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Here's a clue. Snap you fingers.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: That's faster than blinking?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: That is faster than blinking. According to Georgia Tech, it takes seven milliseconds to snap your fingers, more than 20 times quicker than the blink of an eye. The secret is down to friction between the thumb and the third finger. The quickest thing you could possibly do. How fast --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm ready --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's why you were interrupting our Dancing with the Stars commentary?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It threw me off. I was like, what is Brian thinking?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Wow.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You didn't find that fascinating?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: This is my evergreen crap.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And by the way --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: It's not even amusing.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I think it amusing

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's like, I can't think of one "ONE MORE THING." I'll just go to the facts book.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You know what? I don't need this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, he's leaving.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, Brian, don't leave us. That's it for us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Bye, Brian.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Join us tomorrow. "SPECIAL REPORT" starts now.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
